ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I feel like I already had a solid understanding of close reading, and this class helped me develop other skills in order to apply what I read to create unique arguments. I learned a new way of making arguments/claims that approach conceptual ideas. In general, I would say my writing has significantly improved.
How to construct an effective argument. I learned to be more mindful and intentional with my writing choices.
I found this course to strengthen my writing skills greatly. I have a much better understanding of what makes good writing and how the writing process can make my writing better.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Sometimes the material was confusing and difficult to work with, but the professor was very invested in her students and tried to explain when we were confused
Strengths: splits emphasis between reading, writing, and discussion which helps keep the class engaging

This course, as with any other ENG 114, has 3 standardized essays and 1 final project of some sort. As a result, there isn't much I'd suggest to change about my section. Maybe, some examples of successful "A" essays could be included somewhere on Canvas?

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes if they were interested in fashion and wanted a strong foundation of how to write a Yale analytical essay
Yes, I think this class is a great introduction to writing college level essays.

Yes!! Provided me with a brand new perspective on the relationship between fashion and personal identity, and even reshaped my understanding of "fashion" itself. The workload is like any other ENG 114 section, so I'd say to pick this if the name interests you in any way.
Yes, I would highly recommend this course to other people because the writing topics are very interesting and it will make you want to write.
